hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Hermes is a 7-node public testnet for Basecoin 0.6.0. It allows sending tokens to Mercury (our other testnet) through a relay.  [Offline]

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Mercury is a 7-node public testnet based Basecoin 0.6.0.  It allowed sending tokens to Hermes (our other testnet) through a relay.  [Offline]

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Venus is a 7-node public testnet based on Ethermint 0.3.0. It allows you to do everything you can do with the standard Ethereum network, but at 10-times the speed and a much lower cost per transaction. [Offline]

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: sdk1 is a public testnet for the first version of Cosmos SDK.

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Tak is a continually updated development testnet for Cosmos SDK.

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Gaia-1 is the first time Cosmos SDK and Tendermint Core are bundled together to form an experimental version of the Cosmos Hub. It includes a dynamic validator set.

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Gaia-2 includes basic delegation, UI integration for bonding and unbonding, and a PEX reactor for dynamic peer discovery.

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Gaia-3 focuses on the P2P layer. It includes a seed mode, sentry mode architecture, peer IDs, and may bug fixes. Gaia-3 depends on Tendermint 0.16.0.

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Gaia-4 runs on Cosmos SDK 0.10.0. It includes block rewards for validators and commission fees.

hub.title: Testnet
hub.notes: Gaia-5 supports an unbonding period for delegates, HSM, fork and halt detection, as well as a LevelDB server.

sdk.title: Cosmos SDK
sdk.notes: Basecoin is renamed to Cosmos SDK. Everything changed.

sdk.title: Cosmos SDK
sdk.notes: Cosmos SDK 0.10.0 includes the light client daemon.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: The first public release of Tendermint includes address generation from a seed phrase and sending of coins.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Starting from this release (0.7.0 "Tommy") we commit to following a strict semantic versioning discipline and release protocol. In recognition of this monumental occasion, we bumped the version number a few extra times.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.8.0 "Chuckie" includes support for validator set changes, handshakes between Tendermint and app, BFT-liveness fix, and more test coverage.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.9.0 "Phil and Lil" includes a new client API and RPC endpoint for viewing header and commits of particular blocks.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.10.0 "Angelica" includes major updates to configuration, logging, and json serialization. Also includes the Grand Repo-Merge of 2017.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.11.0 "Susie" includes querying for validators at previous heights.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.12.0 "Dil" includes RPC calls for genesis, abci_query, and more.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.13.0 "Constantine" adds new RPC endpoints, a new trust metric for tracking peers, and TxIndexConfig.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.14.0 "Keanu" adds a light-client RPC proxy.

tmc.title: Tendermint
tmc.notes: Tendermint 0.15.0 "Leo" adds an RPC query for transactions at a give block height, a new evidence reactor, state features, and new docs.

gui.title: Netmon UI
gui.notes: Before the Cosmos UI, there was the web-based Tendermint Blockchain Platform UI. TMUI was designed as a multi-blockchain management interface. Components of the platform are used today in Cosmos UI, primarily the network monitor portion.

gui.title: Basecoin UI
gui.notes: The Basecoin UI was conceived as a stripped down cryptocurrency wallet with send, recieve, address list, and theming functionality. The idea is that anyone can fork this wallet for their own cryptocurrency based on Basecoin.

gui.title: Delegation UI
gui.notes: The Delegation UI is a razor-sharp focused user interface for Cosmos ATOM holders to use to bond to Cosmos validators. Functionality included viewing validators, bonding to validators, and voting on proposals.

gui.title: Cosmos UI
gui.notes: Cosmos UI was built together from three parts: the Netmon UI, the Wallet UI, and the Delegation UI. Version 0.1.0 was the first time all three components were integrated in one Electron-based application.

gui.title: Cosmos UI
gui.notes: This is the first public release of Cosmos UI. In this version, you are able to create a Cosmos account. You also have the ability to send and receive tokens on the Gaia-1 testnet.

gui.title: Cosmos UI
gui.notes: In this version, we have updated to the Gaia-2-dev testnet, which has delegation functionality, so you can now bond tokens to validator candidates. It is now a full proof-of-stake system!

gui.title: Cosmos UI
gui.notes: In this release, we upgraded the UI to use the gaia-2 testnet, and added a block explorer, among many other enhancements.

gui.title: Cosmos UI
gui.notes: Cosmos UI 0.5.0 will include support for the light client daemon from Cosmos SDK 0.10.0 as well as block rewards and commission rates for validators.
